sentence.text: We previously reported that brain-derived neurotrophic factor (synapse assembly)/neurotrophic receptor tyrosine kinase 2 (Nprotein phosphorylation2/TRKB) signaling contributes to induction of malignant phenotype of gallbladder cancer (GBC).

Recently, pan-protein phosphorylation inhibitors have been evaluated and their dramatic clinical activity is being shown for a variety of cancer types harboring an NTRK rearrangement in phase I trials.
In this study, we evaluated the anticancer effect of ONO-7579 using GBC cells with or without positive regulation of protein phosphorylation mutant, NOZ, TYGBK-1.
